item.description:
Mystic Stroll

We meet at Courtyard Gallery and then stroll down to various Galleries through the center of Mystic.  We end back again at Courtyard Gallery for a gallery talk with the featured Artists.

 

Come explore a unique, intimate gallery in the heart of historic Mystic, Connecticut. The Courtyard Art Gallery is reminiscent of the private gallery studios of Europe, with rich brick walls, inviting, relaxed environments and gallery directors with personal knowledge about the work being considered.  Open House every Sunday afternoon with light refreshments.  On going show with 2000 sq ft of art, and sculpture set in a European Salon.

Our host: our very own Fran Harkins, who has always been warm and Gracious.

 

Featured Artists: Christopher Zhang and Sunnill Howader

Christopher Zhang believes that visual art should be predicated on realism in order to enhance the reality of the subject.

The artist was born in Shanghai, the city once renowned as the "Oriental Paris". As a child gifted with remarkable talents for sketching and color appreciation, he decided early to become an outstanding artist.  In 1990, he traveled to the United States to pursue and earn his MFA degree from Rhode Island College.

He is a Copley Master and member of the Copley Society of Boston, MA, artist member of The Connecticut Fine Arts Academy, and a past Director and Board Member of the Mystic Arts Center. His work is part of the permanent collection of the Lyman Allyn Museum of Art, New London, CT and the Sun City Art Museum, Phoenix, AZ.

Christopher's work may be seen at the Courtyard Gallery in Mystic, Connecticut.

"Russian Masters taught me how to color the soul of man while American and Western European Masters taught me how to ennoble the figure of man."

 

Allow plenty of time to park...

Parking on street as well as a lot across from the Courtyard Gallery,  in with Mystic Art Center, for a fee
item.name: Mystic Stroll
